CEmail.summary: Provide a class to store and decode all data for an e-mail.
CEmail.remarks: This class provides all necessary methods and properties for checking and receiving e-mail from an Internet POP Server. The class decodes email text string passed into its header components only. HTML and attachment components are decoded as required.

CEmail.AddAttachment.summary: Adds an attachment to the email.
CEmail.AddAttachment.param: The file to attach to the email
The content type to use. The default is 'application/octet-stream'
The Encoding to use. The default is
The filename to use in the message body. The default is the name of the file itself.

CEmail.AttachmentFileList.summary: Array containing the names of the attached files.
CEmail.AttachmentFileList.value: Array containing the names of the attached files.

CEmail.AttachmentInfo.summary: Returns or sets the information about all attachments as a single string. For each attachment there is a separate line. Each line contains: The Fully qualified filename, Content Type, Encoding, ID, Size, ContentId
CEmail.AttachmentInfo.value: or sets the information about all attachments as a single string. For each attachment there is a separate line. Each line contains: The Fully qualified filename, Content Type, Encoding, ID, Size, ContentId

CEmail.AttachmentList.summary: Array of strings containing the encoded contents of the attached files.
CEmail.AttachmentList.value: Array of strings containing the encoded contents of the attached files.

CEmail.BCCList.summary: Array of strings containing the e-mails of all blind carbon copy (BCC) recipients.
CEmail.BCCList.value: Array of strings containing the e-mails of all blind carbon copy (BCC) recipients.

CEmail.Boundary.summary: String value used as boundary for different e-mail parts.
CEmail.Boundary.value: String value used as boundary for different e-mail parts.

CEmail.Cargo.summary: String value for additional user-defined header information.
CEmail.Cargo.value: String value for additional user-defined header information.

CEmail.CCList.summary: Array of strings containing the e-mails of all carbon copy (CC) recipients.
CEmail.CCList.value: Array of strings containing the e-mails of all carbon copy (CC) recipients.

CEmail.CreateHtml.summary: Creates a HTML body based on the text body of the email message.
CEmail.CreateHtml.returns: cHTML a HTML copy of cText.

CEmail.CreateReplyBody.remarks: This method prepares a default reply text and places it in the cText instance variable of the Class. It incorporates a From Address, destination list and datetime stamp. The existing text lines are prefixed with an "> " and any HTML text is cleaned out.

CEmail.DateTimeStamp.summary: A string containing the fully qualified date and time of the email.
CEmail.DateTimeStamp.value: A string containing the fully qualified date and time of the email.

CEmail.Decode.summary: Extract all information from the various parts of an e-mail.
CEmail.Decode.remarks: This method knocks down all of the different parts of the raw e-mail stream and assigns them to appropriate properties.

CEmail.DeleteAttachment.summary: Adds an attachment to the email.
CEmail.DeleteAttachment.param: The index of the attachment to delete

CEmail.DestList.summary: Array of strings containing the e-mail addresses of all recipients.
CEmail.DestList.value: Array of strings containing the e-mail addresses of all recipients.

CEmail.DispositionNotification.summary: A string containing the email address of a party to be notified that the email was received. This is sometimes replaced with a Return Receipt by some email clients.
CEmail.DispositionNotification.value: A string containing the email address of a party to be notified that the email was received. This is sometimes replaced with a Return Receipt by some email clients.

CEmail.EncodeAttachment.summary: Provide a method to encode the provided file and provide the mail section header to properly define the attachment to the email.
CEmail.EncodeAttachment.param: The full path name to the file to be attached.
CEmail.EncodeAttachment.returns: STRING containing error information. The string will be empty if the encoding was successful.
CEmail.EncodeAttachment.remarks: This method encodes the presented filename with Base64 Encoding and formats the full text for an attachment section and adds it to the email.

CEmail.Error.summary: Numeric value representing the last error code that occurred.
CEmail.Error.value: Numeric value representing the last error code that occurred.

CEmail.ErrorMsg.summary: A string representing the error description.
CEmail.ErrorMsg.value: A string representing the error description.

CEmail.FindBoundary.summary: Locate a boundary within an email section
CEmail.FindBoundary.param: The email section text in which the search is to take place.
CEmail.FindBoundary.remarks: This method can be used to find the main boundary of the email body or a sub boundary.

CEmail.FullFromAddress.summary: The From Address as specified in the email header.
CEmail.FullFromAddress.value: The From Address as specified in the email header.

CEmail.GetAttachmentInfo.summary: Method to decode all header elements of an email
CEmail.GetAttachmentInfo.remarks: This method reads the current raw email data and decodes all header elements into their respective ivars. The process also decodes and separates all addressees and resolves names, datetime stamps, priority and receipt requirements.

CEmail.GetHeaderInfo.summary: Method to decode all header elements of an email
CEmail.GetHeaderInfo.remarks: This method reads the current raw email data and decodes all header elements into their respective ivars. The process also decodes and separates all addressees and resolves names, datetime stamps, priority and receipt requirements.

CEmail.HTMLText.summary: A properly formed HTML text string suitable for display in a web browser pane. If the email did not contain an HTM component, one is formed from the Text component by wrapping it in appropriate tags. If the email did contain HTML and had embedded images (marked with src="cid:) then these references will be replaced with references to the actual files names of these images.
CEmail.HTMLText.value: A properly formed HTML text string suitable for display in a web browser pane. If the email did not contain an HTM component, one is formed from the Text component by wrapping it in appropriate tags. If the email did contain HTML and had embedded images (marked with src="cid:) then these references will be replaced with references to the actual files names of these images.

CEmail.MailDate.summary: Date value representing the e-mail's received (sent) data.
CEmail.MailDate.value: Date value representing the e-mail's received (sent) data.

CEmail.MailHeader.summary: String containing the mail's header text.
CEmail.MailHeader.value: String containing the mail's header text.

CEmail.MailPriority.summary: Numeric value representing the e-mail priority.
CEmail.MailPriority.value: Numeric value representing the e-mail priority.

CEmail.MailTime.summary: Time string representing the e-mail's sent time.
CEmail.MailTime.value: Time string representing the e-mail's sent time.

CEmail.MimeEncode.summary: Method to encode a string using a specific encoding or the default encoding of an email
CEmail.MimeEncode.param: Optional String to encode. The default is to encode the body
Optional encoding type to use. VO supports the following two encodings: CODING_TYPE_PRINTABLE (the default) CODING_TYPE_BASE64

CEmail.MimeHeader.summary: Method to encode an MIME Attachment header
CEmail.MimeHeader.param: Optional encoding type to use. VO supports the following two encodings: CODING_TYPE_PRINTABLE (the default) CODING_TYPE_BASE64

Content type to use when encoding. The default is the content type of the message. When one of the following is used VO will assume that the file is part of the body: If another type is used, VO will assume that the file is not part of the message body but an attachment
File name to use for the encoded header. This name is not used for the three content types mentioned above.
CEmail.MimeHeader.remarks: The MimeHeader() method is called by the CEMail:StreamOut() method during the streaming of the message.

CEmail.Priority.summary: A numeric value representing the priority of the email (normal = 3).
CEmail.Priority.value: A numeric value representing the priority of the email (normal = 3).

CEmail.ReplyTo.summary: String value containing the e-mail to which a reply is being sent.
CEmail.ReplyTo.value: String value containing the e-mail to which a reply is being sent.

CEmail.ReturnReceipt.summary: A string containing the email address of a party to be sent a receipt advice. Some email clients may use this to contain a return receipt and others may use Disposition Notification instead.
CEmail.ReturnReceipt.value: A string containing the email address of a party to be sent a receipt advice. Some email clients may use this to contain a return receipt and others may use Disposition Notification instead.

CEmail.SaveAs.summary: Decode and save the specified encoded attachment of an e-mail as a local file.
CEmail.SaveAs.param: The directory in which the file is to be saved. If not specified, the attachment will be saved within the current directory.
String containing a new file name for the attachment being saved. If not specified, the attachment will be saved under the file name contained in the attachment e-mail header.
Number specifying which of the multiple attachments should be decoded and saved as a file. If not specified, the first attachment will be saved.
CEmail.SaveAs.remarks: This method decodes the specified encoded attachment and saves it either under the specified or default file name.

CEmail.SetAttachmentInfo.summary: This method allows you to replace elements of the internal attachment array of the email object.
CEmail.SetAttachmentInfo.param: The element in the attachment array that needs to be replaced

The type of information that needs to be replaced. This can be one of: ATTACH_STOREID (1) ATTACH_CONTENTID (2) ATTACH_FILESIZE (3) ATTACH_FILENAME (4) ATTACH_CONTENTTYPE (5) ATTACH_TRANSFERENCODING (6) ATTACH_FULLPATH (7) ATTACH_SIZE (8)
CEmail.SetAttachmentInfo.returns: The old value for the attachment array element

CEmail.SetHeaderInfo.summary: Method to encode all header elements of an email
CEmail.SetHeaderInfo.remarks: This method reads the properties of the Email object and creates a header from these properties. It also assigns the header to the Header property of the email. This method is called from CEmail:StreamOut during the streaming of the email message.

CEmail.SetMailTime.summary: Create an ANSI Date/Time based on current date and time.
CEmail.SetMailTime.remarks: This method creates a string containing the date and time in a format that can be understood by all Internet servers. The resulting string can be used via the TimeStamp access.

CEmail.StreamIn.summary: This method gets called when an email messages is received. It calls into the Storage object to decode and store attachments.
CEmail.StreamIn.param: The string that was received and needs to be decoded
CEmail.StreamIn.remarks:
There is usually no need to call this method yourself. It gets called from the CPop class when receiving emails. It also gets called from the CEMail:Decode() message when decoding a raw message.
Visual Objects tries to avoid building large emails completely in memory. Therefore it reads or writes them in chunks. The StreamIn() and StreamOut() methods on the CEmail class handle these chunks.

CEmail.StreamOut.remarks:
There is usually no need to call this message directly. It is called repeatedly from CSmtp:SendMail() when sending emails.
Visual Objects tries to avoid building large emails completely in memory. Therefore it reads or writes them in chunks. The StreamIn() and StreamOut() methods on the CEmail class handle these chunks.

CEmail.StreamStart.summary: Initialize the Stream Status of an email message.
CEmail.StreamStart.remarks:
There is usually no need to call this message directly. It is called repeatedly from CSmtp:SendMail() when sending emails, from CPop when receiving mails and from CEmail:Decode when decoding mails
Visual Objects tries to avoid building large emails completely in memory. Therefore it reads or writes them in chunks. The StreamIn() and StreamOut() methods on the CEmail class handle these chunks.

CEmail.Subject.summary: String value containing the e-mail subject.
CEmail.Subject.value: String value containing the e-mail subject.

CEmail.TimeStamp.summary: String value containing the date and time that the e-mail was sent.
CEmail.TimeStamp.value: String value containing the date and time that the e-mail was sent.

CFtp.summary: Wrapper class for high-level File Transfer Protocol (FTP) functions provided by Microsoft in Wininet.dll.
CFtp.remarks: This class provides all necessary methods and properties for file transfer and exchange using File Transfer Protocol.

CFtp.ctor.param: Name of the application or entity calling subsequent methods. The default is 'VO Ftp Client'.
Port number. The default FTP port number is 21.
Logical value specifying whether the CFtp:InternetStatus() method should be called for status callback notifications. The default is TRUE.

CFtp.AccessType.summary: Numeric value representing the required access. The application can select one of these type values: INTERNET_OPEN_TYPE_DIRECT Resolve all host names locally. INTERNET_OPEN_TYPE_PROXY Pass requests to the proxy specified by CFtp:Proxy unless a proxy bypass list is supplied by CFtp:ProxyBypass and the name to be resolved bypasses the proxy. In this case, the function proceeds as for INTERNET_OPEN_TYPE_DIRECT. INTERNET_OPEN_TYPE_PRECONFIG Retrieve the proxy or direct configuration from the registry.
CFtp.AccessType.value: Numeric value representing the required access.

CFtp.CloseFile.param: Handle of a previously opened remote file.
CFtp.CloseFile.remarks: This method should be used to close the handle returned from the OpenFile() method.

CFtp.CloseRemote.summary: Shut down the current Internet FTP connection.
CFtp.CloseRemote.remarks: This method can be used to close the connection made for the CFtp object instance. If not specified, the connection will be automatically closed if the appropriate object instance goes out of scope.

CFtp.Connected.summary: Logical value representing the connection status.
CFtp.Connected.value: Logical value representing the connection status.

CFtp.ConnectRemote.summary: Connect an application to a remote FTP server.
CFtp.ConnectRemote.param: String containing the host name of an Internet server. Alternately, the string can contain the IP number of the site in ASCII dotted-decimal format (for example, 11.22.3.45).
String that contains the name of the user to log on. If this parameter is NULL, the function uses the appropriate default ('anonymous'). For the FTP protocol, the default is anonymous.
User's password as a string. For anonymous login users, the user's e-mail name can be used as password.
CFtp.ConnectRemote.remarks: This method establishes a connection to a remote FTP server.
CFtp.ConnectRemote.example:
The following example creates a list of all files and directories of the X# download section at ftp.cai.com:
FUNC ListVOFiles() LOCAL oFTP AS CFtp LOCAL lRet AS LOGIC LOCAL aRet AS ARRAY LOCAL i AS INT oFTP := CFtp{"VO Sample FTP Agent"} IF oFTP:ConnectRemote("ftp.cai.com", ; "anonymous", ; "Darth.Vader@starwars.com") oFTP:SetCurDir("/pub/vo") ? "Contents of Directory " + oFTP:GetCurDir() aRet := oFTP:Directory("*.*") FOR i := 1 UPTO ALen(aRet) ? aRet[i, F_NAME] ?? ", Size: " + NTrim(aRet[i, F_SIZE]) ?? ", Date/Time: " + DToC(aRet[i, F_DATE]) + ; "/" + aRet[i, F_TIME] ?? ", Attribute(s): ", aRet[i, F_ATTR] NEXT ENDIF oFTP:CloseRemote() RETURN lRet

CFtp.CreateDir.summary: Create a new directory on the FTP server.
CFtp.CreateDir.param: String that contains the name of the directory that is to be created.
CFtp.CreateDir.remarks: This method creates a new directory on the remote FTP server.

CFtp.DeleteFile.summary: Delete a file stored on the FTP server.
CFtp.DeleteFile.param: String that contains the name of the file to be deleted on the remote FTP server.
CFtp.DeleteFile.remarks: This method removes a file from a remote FTP server.

CFtp.Directory.summary: Create an array of directory and file information about the remote FTP server.
CFtp.Directory.param: The file specification for the search. Besides a file name, this specification can include an optional drive, directory, and extension. The file name and extension can include the standard wildcard characters (* and ?). If you do not specify a drive and directory, the Windows defaults are used. If you do not specify any file name, '*.*' is assumed.
CFtp.Directory.returns: An array of subarrays, with each subarray containing information about each file matching . The subarray elements are referenced as shown in the example under the CFtp:ConnectRemote() Method section.
CFtp.Directory.remarks: This method returns information about files in the current or specified directory. You can use it to perform actions on groups of files.

CFtp.Error.summary: Numeric value representing the last occurring error code.
CFtp.Error.value: Numeric value representing the last occurring error code.

CFtp.ErrorMsg.summary: A string representing the error description.
CFtp.ErrorMsg.value: A string representing the error description.

CFtp.GetCurDir.summary: Get the name of the current directory on the remote FTP server for the current process.
CFtp.GetCurDir.returns: Name of the current directory, if successful; otherwise, NULL_STRING.
CFtp.GetCurDir.remarks: This method retrieves the directory name on the remote FTP server for the current process.

CFtp.GetFile.summary: Receive a file from the FTP server.
CFtp.GetFile.param: Name of the remote file that has to be received.
String that contains the name of the file to create on the local system. If not specified, automatically becomes the name of the local file.
Logical value indicating whether the method should proceed if a local file of the specified name already exists. If is TRUE and the local file exists, the GetFile() method fails.

Flags that control how the function will handle the file download. The first set of flag values indicates the conditions under which the transfer occurs. These transfer type flags can be used in combination with the second set of flags that control caching. The application can select one of these transfer type values: The following flags handle how the caching of this file will be handled. Any combination of the following flags can be used with the transfer type flag. The possible values are:
CFtp.GetFile.remarks: This method retrieves a file from an FTP server and stores it under the specified name as a local file.
CFtp.GetFile.example:
The following receives the comprehensive list (00index.txt) of all files contained in the X# download section at ftp.cai.com:
FUNC TestGetFile() LOCAL oFTP AS CFtp LOCAL cFile AS STRING oFTP := CFtp{"VO Sample FTP Agent"} IF oFTP:ConnectRemote("ftp.cai.com", ; "anonymous", ; "Darth.Vader@starwars.com") cFile := "00index.txt" IF oFTP:SetCurDir("/pub/vo") IF oFTP:GetFile(cFile) IF File(cFile) ? "File received: " + FPathName() ENDIF ELSE __RaiseFTPError(oFTP) ENDIF ELSE __RaiseFTPError(oFTP) ENDIF ENDIF oFTP:CloseRemote() RETURN STATIC FUNC __RaiseFTPError (oFTP AS CFtp) AS INT ; PASCAL LOCAL cError AS STRING LOCAL nRet AS INT nRet := oFTP:Error IF nRet > 0 cError := oFTP:ErrorMsg IF SLen(cError) > 0 MessageBox(0, cError, "FTP Error", MB_OK) ENDIF ENDIF RETURN nRet

CFtp.InternetStatus.summary: Method InternetStatus() is a callback placeholder to receive current status information for an FTP session. It should be overloaded by subclasses to implement the desired behavior.
CFtp.InternetStatus.param: Application-defined context value associated with the current class.
Status code that indicates the reason for calling. It can be one of the following values:
Address of a buffer that contains information pertinent to this call to the callback function.
CFtp.InternetStatus.remarks: The InternetStatus() method can be used to receive different status information at any stage of an FTP transfer between the FTP client and server.
CFtp.InternetStatus.example:
The following example demonstrates using the InternetStatus() method to notify every status change to the owner window:
CLASS MyFTP INHERIT CFtp PROTECT oOwner AS OBJECT METHOD Init(oParent, cCaption, n, lStat)CLASS MyFtp SUPER:Init(cCaption, n, lStat) SELF:oOwner := oParent RETURN SELF METHOD InternetStatus( nContext, nStatus, ; pStatusInfo, nStatusLength ) CLASS MyFTP // // This method receives all Low Level FTP // notification. Please keep all parameters if you // want to overwrite it for your own purpose // LOCAL cMsg AS STRING DO CASE CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_RESOLVING_NAME cMsg := "Resolving Name ... " CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_NAME_RESOLVED cMsg := "Name resolved" CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_CONNECTING_TO_SERVER cMsg := "Connecting to Server ... " CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_CONNECTED_TO_SERVER cMsg := "Connected to Server" CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_SENDING_REQUEST cMsg := "Sending Request ... " CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_REQUEST_SENT cMsg := "Request sent" CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_RECEIVING_RESPONSE cMsg := "Receiving response ..." CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_RESPONSE_RECEIVED cMsg := "Response received" CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_CTL_RESPONSE_RECEIVED cMsg := "CTL Response received" CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_PREFETCH cMsg := "Prefetch" CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_CLOSING_CONNECTION cMsg := "Closing Connection ..." CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_CONNECTION_CLOSED cMsg := "Connection closed" CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_HANDLE_CREATED cMsg := "Handle created" // _DebOut32( "FTP Status : " + cMsg ) RETURN CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_HANDLE_CLOSING cMsg := "Closing handle ..." CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_REQUEST_COMPLETE cMsg := "Request complete" CASE nStatus == INTERNET_STATUS_REDIRECT cMsg := "Redirect" OTHERWISE cMsg := "Unkown FTP Status" ENDCASE SELF:oOwner:FTPStatus := cMsg RETURN NIL

CFtp.Open.summary: Initialize an application's use of the Win32 Internet functions.
CFtp.Open.param: Flag that indicates various options affecting the behavior of the methods. It can be a combination of these values: INTERNET_FLAG_OFFLINE Satisfy download operations on this handle through the persistent cache only. If the item does not exist in the cache, the method returns an appropriate error code. INTERNET_FLAG_ASYNC Future operations on this handle may fail with ERROR_IO_PENDING.
String containing the name of the proxy server to use if proxy access was specified. If this parameter is NIL, the function reads proxy information from the registry.

Array with host names or IP addresses, or both, that are known locally. Requests to these names are not routed through the proxy. The strings can contain wildcards, such as {'157.55.*', '*int*'}, meaning any IP address starting with 157.55, or any name containing the substring 'int', will bypass the proxy. If this array contains the '<local>' string as the only entry, the function bypasses any host name that does not contain a period. For example, 'www.cai.com' would be routed to the proxy, whereas 'internet' would not. If this parameter is NIL, the function reads the bypass list from the registry.
CFtp.Open.remarks: This method initializes internal data structures and prepares for future calls to CFtp methods. It does not have to be called explicitly, because the CFtp:ConnectRemote() method internally calls this method, if necessary.

CFtp.OpenFile.summary: Open a remote file for writing or reading.
CFtp.OpenFile.param: String containing the name of the file that has to be accessed on the remote system.
Numeric value determining the type of file access (GENERIC_READ or GENERIC_WRITE â€” not both). The default is GENERIC_READ.

Conditions for operation with the specified file. The application should select one transfer type and any of the flags that control how the caching of the file will be controlled. The transfer type can be any one of the following values: The application can use one or more of the following values to control the caching of the file:
CFtp.OpenFile.returns: File handle, if successful; otherwise, NULL_PTR.
CFtp.OpenFile.remarks: The OpenFile() method initializes a remote file handle for subsequent file operations. The handle remains open until calling the CloseFile() method, and it can be used to call functions like InternetReadFile() or InternetWriteFile(), InternetCloseHandle(), or FtpFindFirstFile().

CFtp.PassWord.summary: A string representing the password for the FTP session.
CFtp.PassWord.value: A string representing the password for the FTP session.

CFtp.Proxy.summary: A string containing the name of the proxy server (or servers) to use for Internet connections.
CFtp.Proxy.value: A string containing the name of the proxy server (or servers) to use for Internet connections.

CFtp.ProxyBypass.summary: A string containing an optional list of host names or IP addresses, or both, that are known locally. Requests to these names are not routed through the proxy. The list can contain wildcards, such as "130.126.*.* *dev*", meaning that any IP address starting with 130.126 or any name containing the substring "dev" will bypass the proxy.
CFtp.ProxyBypass.value: A string containing an optional list of host names or IP addresses, or both, that are known locally. Requests to these names are not routed through the proxy. The list can contain wildcards, such as "130.126.*.* *dev*", meaning that any IP address starting with 130.126 or any name containing the substring "dev" will bypass the proxy.

CFtp.PutFile.summary: Store a file on the FTP server.
CFtp.PutFile.param: Name of the local file that is to be sent to the remote FTP server.
String that contains the name of the file to create on the remote FTP server. If not specified, <cLocalFile> automatically becomes the name of the remote file.
Logical value indicating whether the method should proceed if a remote file of the specified name already exists. If is TRUE and the remote file exists, method PutFile() fails.

Flags that control how the function will handle the file upload and the conditions under which the transfers occur. The application should select one transfer type and any of the flags that control how the caching of the file will be controlled. The transfer type can be any one of the following values: The application can use one or more of the following values to control the caching of the file:
CFtp.PutFile.remarks: This method handles all of the necessary processes associated with reading a file locally and storing it on an FTP server.
CFtp.PutFile.example:
The following receives the comprehensive list (00index.txt) of all files contained in the X# download section at ftp.cai.com:
FUNC TestGetFile() LOCAL oFTP AS CFtp LOCAL cFile AS STRING oFTP := CFtp{"VO Sample FTP Agent"} IF oFTP:ConnectRemote("ftp.cai.com", ; "anonymous", ; "Darth.Vader@starwars.com") cFile := "00index.txt" IF oFTP:SetCurDir("/pub/vo") IF oFTP:GetFile(cFile) IF File(cFile) ? "File received: " + FPathName() ENDIF ELSE __RaiseFTPError(oFTP) ENDIF ELSE __RaiseFTPError(oFTP) ENDIF oFTP:CloseRemote() RETURN STATIC FUNC __RaiseFTPError (oFTP AS CFtp) AS INT PASCAL LOCAL cError AS STRING LOCAL nRet AS INT nRet := oFTP:Error IF nRet > 0 cError := oFTP:ErrorMsg IF SLen(cError) > 0 MessageBox(0, cError, "FTP Error", MB_OK) ENDIF ENDIF RETURN nRet

CFtp.RemoteHost.summary: A string representing the name of the FTP server to which you want to connect.
CFtp.RemoteHost.value: A string representing the name of the FTP server to which you want to connect.

CFtp.RemoveDir.summary: Delete a directory from the remote FTP server.
CFtp.RemoveDir.param: String that contains the name of the directory that is to be removed.
CFtp.RemoveDir.remarks: This method removes a directory from the remote FTP server.

CFtp.RenameFile.summary: Rename a file stored on the FTP server.
CFtp.RenameFile.param: String that contains the name of the file to be renamed on the remote FTP server.
The new name to give to the file.
CFtp.RenameFile.remarks: The RenameFile() method renames a file on the remote FTP server.

CFtp.SetCurDir.summary: Change the current directory on the remote FTP server for the current process.
CFtp.SetCurDir.param: String that contains the path of the directory to change to.
CFtp.SetCurDir.remarks: The SetCurDir() method changes the directory on the remote FTP server for the current process.

CFtp.UserName.summary: A string for identifying the user for the FTP connection.
CFtp.UserName.value: A string for identifying the user for the FTP connection.

CHttp.summary: Wrapper class for an Http (Hypertext transfer protocol) session.
CHttp.remarks: This class provides all necessary methods and properties for an HyperText Transfer Protocol session.

CHttp.ctor.summary: Instantiates a new Http wrapper object.
CHttp.ctor.param: An optional caption as a string.
The HTTP port address ( the default is 80 ).

CHttp.AddRequestHeaders.summary: Adds additional headers to the current request.
CHttp.AddRequestHeaders.param: Contains the headers to append to the request. Each header must be terminated by a CR/LF (carriage return/line feed) pair.
Contains values used to modify the semantics of this function (see HttpAddRequestHeaders in the Win32 Internet API help for possible values).

CHttp.ConnectRemote.param: The host name or IP address of the remote server.

CHttp.Directory.summary: If an ftp server is accessed via http, this method returns an array of the files of the current directory.
CHttp.Directory.returns: An array of the files in the current directory on the ftp server.

CHttp.FtpRequest.summary: Indicates that the http connection is being used to access an ftp server.
CHttp.FtpRequest.value: Indicates that the http connection is being used to access an ftp server.

CHttp.GetCurDir.summary: Gets the name of the current directory on the remote server.
CHttp.GetCurDir.returns: The directory name as a string.

CHttp.GetDocumentByURL.summary: Retrieves a document from the server.
CHttp.GetDocumentByURL.param: The URL of the document to retrieve.

CHttp.GetDocumentFromServer.summary: Retrieves a document from the server.
CHttp.GetDocumentFromServer.param: The server to retrieve the file from.

CHttp.GetFile.summary: Retrieves the remote file cRemoteFile to the (local) file cNewFile.
CHttp.GetFile.param: The name of the file on the remote server to retrieve.
The name to use when saving the file on the local drive.
IF lFailIfExists is set to TRUE the method will fail if the file exists on the local disk. If it is set to FALSE an existing file will be over written.
CHttp.GetFile.returns: TRUE if the file is saved, otherwise FALSE.

CHttp.GetResponse.summary: Gets the response for the current request.
CHttp.GetResponse.returns: The response for the current request as a string.

CHttp.GetResponseHeader.summary: Gets the response header for the current request.
CHttp.GetResponseHeader.returns: The response header for the current request as a string.

CHttp.Open.param: Contains flags used in the internal InternetConnect call (see Win32 Internet API help for possible values).
Array of server names that should not be accessed through the proxy (optional).
CHttp.Open.returns: TRUE if the connection was opened, otherwise FALSE.

CPop.summary: Provide a class for Internet Post Office Protocol (POP).
CPop.remarks: This class provides all necessary methods and properties for checking and receiving e-mail from an Internet POP Server.

CPop.ctor.param: String containing the host name of a valid POP server. Alternately, the string can contain the IP number of the POP server in ASCII dotted-decimal format (for example, 11.22.3.45).

CPop.CheckReply.summary: Check the response from a POP server for error codes.
CPop.CheckReply.remarks: This method checks the response string from the POP server for error codes, and sets the ReplyCode, ReplyString and Error properties.

CPop.connect.summary: Establish a connection to the remote POP server.
CPop.connect.param: String containing the host name of an Internet server. Alternately, the string can contain the IP number of the POP server in ASCII dotted-decimal format (for example, 11.22.3.45).
Port number at . If not specified, the connection will be established to port SELF:RemotePort. The default value is IPPORT_POP (110).
CPop.connect.remarks: This method establishes a connection to the specified remote mail server at port or SELF:RemotePort.

CPop.DeleteMail.summary: Delete specified mail from a remote POP server.
CPop.DeleteMail.param: The number of the e-mail message to be deleted from the queue.
CPop.DeleteMail.remarks: This method removes the specified e-mail message from a remote POP server.
CPop.DeleteMail.example:
The following function collects all waiting e-mail messages and deletes them from the remote POP server:
FUNC POPGetMails (cServerIP AS STRING,; cUser AS STRING,; cPassW AS STRING,; lDelete AS LOGIC ) AS ARRAY ; PASCAL LOCAL oPop AS CPop LOCAL aRet AS ARRAY LOCAL i,n AS INT oPop := CPop{cServerIP} IF oPop:Logon(cUser, cPassW) oPop:GetStatus() n := oPop:MailCount aRet := oPop:ListMail() IF lDelete // Deleting all messages FOR i := 1 TO n oPop:DeleteMail(i) NEXT ENDIF ENDIF oPop:Disconnect() RETURN aRet

CPop.Disconnect.summary: Shut down the current POP connection.
CPop.Disconnect.remarks: This method can be used to close the connection to a POP3 Server.

CPop.GetList.summary: Method to return an array of information regarding a particular email waiting on the server.
CPop.GetList.param: The number of the email being investigated
CPop.GetList.returns: ARRAY of strings representing the date, time, sender name and subject for that email. {cDate, cTime, cSender, cSubject}
CPop.GetList.remarks: This method consults the server and returns information about emails waiting to be downloaded. The user can then make decisions about which mails to download or delete.

CPop.GetMail.summary: Read specified mail from a remote POP server.
CPop.GetMail.param: The number of the e-mail message to be read from the queue.
CPop.GetMail.remarks: This method reads the specified e-mail message from a remote POP server and decodes it into its MailHeader, MailBody, and Attachment parts.
CPop.GetMail.example:
The following function reads the specified e-mail messages from a remote POP server:
FUNC POPReadMail (cServerIP AS STRING,; cUser AS STRING,; cPassW AS STRING,; nMail AS INT ) AS ARRAY ; PASCAL LOCAL oPop AS CPop LOCAL aRet AS ARRAY LOCAL n AS INT oPop := CPop{cServerIP} IF oPop:Logon(cUser, cPassW) oPop:GetStatus() n := oPop:MailCount IF nMail <= n IF oPop:GetMail(nMail) aRet := ArrayCreate(3) aRet[1] := oPop:MailHeader aRet[2] := oPop:MailBody aRet[3] := oPop:Attachment ENDIF ENDIF ENDIF oPop:Disconnect() RETURN aRet

CPop.GetStatus.summary: Retrieve the mail status for the current active user from a remote POP server.
CPop.GetStatus.returns: A string containing the current status.
CPop.GetStatus.remarks: This method asks for the status for the current active user, who must be logged on, and saves the results to the MailHeader, MailCount, and TotalBytes properties.

CPop.ListMail.summary: Read all e-mails from a remote POP server.
CPop.ListMail.returns: Array with all e-mails, if successful; otherwise, an empty array.
CPop.ListMail.remarks: This method reads all e-mails from a remote POP server and puts them into an array as raw strings containing each header, body, and attachment.

CPop.ListMailIDs.summary: Method to return an array of mail IDs of emails waiting on the server for download.
CPop.ListMailIDs.returns: ARRAY of mail IDs with the following format. {{nNum, cID}, â€¦}
CPop.ListMailIDs.remarks: This method consults the server and returns a list of mail numbers and their corresponding ID. This information can be used to prevent duplicated downloads where headers are inspected or mails downloaded but not deleted from the server.

CPop.LogOn.summary: Log a user onto a connected POP server.

CPop.MailCount.summary: Numeric value representing the number of e-mails for the specific user.
CPop.MailCount.value: Numeric value representing the number of e-mails for the specific user.

CPop.ReceiveBytes.summary: Numeric value representing the number of bytes received.
CPop.ReceiveBytes.value: Numeric value representing the number of bytes received.

CPop.RecvRemote.summary: Receive response data from a remote mail server.
CPop.RecvRemote.remarks: This method receives data from the connected remote POP server. Received data is stored to the ReplyString property.

CPop.TotalBytes.summary: Total size of all e-mails for the specific user.
CPop.TotalBytes.value: Total size of all e-mails for the specific user.

CSmtp.summary: Provide a class for Internet Protocol SMTP.
CSmtp.remarks: This class provides all necessary methods and properties for sending e-mail to a Simple Message Transfer Protocol (SMTP) server.

CSmtp.ctor.param: A CEmail object. If omitted, a generic (empty) CEmail object is created.
Name of the remote host that the class should connect to
Email port of the remote host that the class should connect to. Defaults to 25

CSmtp.CheckReply.summary: Check the response from a mail server for error codes.
CSmtp.CheckReply.remarks: This method checks for a response string from a mail server for error codes and sets the properties, ReplyCode, ReplyString, and Error.
CSmtp.CheckReply.example:
The following example checks the connection to Computer Associates mail server:
FUNC SmtpTest() LOCAL oSmtp AS CSMTP oSmtp := CSMTP{"ServerCheck", "", "", "Check "} oSmtp:Timeout := 1000 oSmtp:Connect("mail2.cai.com") oSmtp:CheckReply() ? oSmtp:ReplyString ? oSmtp:ReplyCode ? oSmtp:Error oSmtp:Disconnect()

CSmtp.connect.summary: Establish a connection to a remote SMTP server.
CSmtp.connect.param: String containing the host name of an Internet server. Alternately, the string can contain the IP number of the site in ASCII dotted-decimal format (for example, 11.22.3.45).
Port number at . If not specified, the connection will be established to port SELF:RemotePort. The default value is IPPORT_SMTP (25).
CSmtp.connect.remarks: This method establishes a connection to the specified remote mail server at port or SELF:RemotePort.

CSmtp.Disconnect.summary: Shut down the current SMTP connection.
CSmtp.Disconnect.remarks: This method can be used to close the connection to the SMTP server.

CSmtp.Email.summary: An instance of the CEmail class.
CSmtp.Email.value: An instance of the CEmail class.

CSmtp.Logon.summary: Logs on to the remote host with the user name and password of the smtp class
CSmtp.Logon.returns: Logic indicating if the Login was succesful

CSmtp.MailApplication.summary: A string that holds the name that is used when connection to mail servers
CSmtp.MailApplication.value: A string that holds the name that is used when connection to mail servers

CSmtp.RecvRemote.summary: Receive response data from a remote mail server.
CSmtp.RecvRemote.remarks: This method receives data from the connected remote mail server. Received data is stored to the ReplyString property.

CSmtp.SecureSMTP.summary: A logic indicating if the CSmtp class should use Secure SMTP
CSmtp.SecureSMTP.value: A logic indicating if the CSmtp class should use Secure SMTP

CSmtp.SendAttachedFile.summary: Send an attached file as part of an e-mail to a remote SMTP server.
CSmtp.SendAttachedFile.param: The file, optionally including the drive letter and path, to be sent.
CSmtp.SendAttachedFile.remarks: SendAttachedFile() is called from the SendMail() method to encode and send the file specified by SELF:AttachmentFile to the remote SMTP Server.

CSmtp.SendHeaderInfo.summary: Create a mail header and send it as part of an e-mail to a remote SMTP server.
CSmtp.SendHeaderInfo.remarks: SendHeaderInfo() is called from the SendMail() method to prepare and send the appropriate header to the remote SMTP server. The method does not take any parameters. The values for the FROM, TO, CC and BCC are read from the Email property of the cSMTP class.

CSmtp.SendMail.summary: Send a complete e-mail to a remote SMTP server.
CSmtp.SendMail.remarks: This method sends the complete e-mail to the remote SMTP Server. Based on the SELF:MailBody, SELF:AttachmentFile, SELF:DestList, SELF:CCList, SELF:FromAddress and SELF:RemoteHost values, the SendMail()method prepares all necessary data including header and control sequences, and calls the SELF:SendHeaderInfo(), SendMailBody() and SELF:SendAttachedFile() methods at different stages of that transaction.

CSmtp.SendMailBody.summary: This method is no longer available in <%APPVER%>

CSmtp.TextEncoding.summary: The text encoding type of the email.
CSmtp.TextEncoding.value: The text encoding type of the email.

CSocket.summary: Provide a class for low-level TCP/IP programming.
CSocket.remarks: This class provides low-level socket functionality that can be used to implement different Internet protocols.

CSocket.ctor.param: The type of the newly created socket. Valid values are:

CSocket.accept.summary: Accept a new connection on a socket.
CSocket.accept.returns: A new CSocket object instance, if successful; otherwise, NULL_OBJECT.
CSocket.accept.remarks: This method can be used to make Internet server applications wait for a client's connection.
CSocket.accept.example:
The following example implements a simple socket server function listening for first connections at port 7:
FUNCTION ServerTest() LOCAL oSocket AS CSocket LOCAL oSockMsg AS CSocket LOCAL cData AS STRING LOCAL cFrom AS STRING LOCAL nPort AS INT LOCAL lRet AS LOGIC oSocket := CSocket{SOCK_STREAM} IF oSocket:bind(7, NULL_STRING, AF_INET) oSocket:listen(1) lRet := .F. oSockMsg := oSocket:accept() IF oSockMsg != NULL_OBJECT cData := oSockMsg:GetLine() oSockMsg:getpeername(@cFrom, @nPort) ? "Connection accepted from ", cFrom, ; , client port: , NTrim(nPort) ? "Received data: ", cData lRet := .T. ENDIF oSockMsg:Close() ENDIF oSocket:Close() RETURN lRet

CSocket.bind.summary: Associate a local address with a socket.
CSocket.bind.param: String containing the local name of an Internet server. Alternately, the string can contain the IP number of the site in ASCII dotted-decimal format (for example, 11.22.3.45). If NULL_STRING is specified, the local host name is assumed.
SHORTINT number specifying the Address Family.

CSocket.Close.summary: Disconnects the socket and closes it.
CSocket.Close.remarks: This method disconnects a connection and then closes it. If a socket is not closed in code, it will be automatically closed if the appropriate object instance goes out of scope.

CSocket.connect.summary: Establish a connection of the socket instance to a peer.
CSocket.connect.param: String containing the host name of an Internet server. Alternately, the string can contain the IP number of the site in ASCII dotted-decimal format (for example, 11.22.3.45).
CSocket.connect.remarks: This method establishes a connection to the specified remote address at port .
CSocket.connect.example:
The following example checks whether a remote SMTP server is currently available:
FUNCTION Start IF CheckRemote("mail2.cai.com", IPPORT_SMTP, 1000) ? "CA's mail server is available" ELSE ? "Mail server currently not accessible" ENDIF FUNCTION CheckRemote (cServer AS STRING, nPort AS INT, ; nTimeout AS INT); AS LOGIC PASCAL LOCAL oSocket AS CSocket LOCAL lRet AS LOGIC oSocket := CSocket{SOCK_STREAM} oSocket:TimeOut := nTimeout lRet := oSocket:connect(cServer, nPort) oSocket:Close() RETURN lRet

CSocket.DisConnect.summary: Shut down the current socket connection. This disables sending/receiving on the socket, but does NOT close the socket. Note that this function does NOT close the connection like it did in Visual Objects 2.5! To close a socket you need to call cSocket:Close()!
CSocket.DisConnect.remarks: Disconnect() can be used to close the connection made for the CSocket object instance. If not specified, the connection will automatically be closed if the appropriate object instance goes out of scope.

CSocket.Error.summary: Numeric value representing the error code.
CSocket.Error.value: Numeric value representing the error code.

CSocket.GetLine.summary: Extract the first line from the socket data received via the current connection.
CSocket.GetLine.returns: String containing the received line of data, if successful; otherwise, NULL_STRING
CSocket.GetLine.remarks: This method extracts the first line from input data. GetLine() can be used for TCP sockets only, because it assumes that a connection is already established.

CSocket.GetLineFrom.summary: Wait for connection and extract first line from incoming data.
CSocket.GetLineFrom.param: Reference to a string to receive the client's IP address.
Reference to a DWORD value to receive the client's port number.
CSocket.GetLineFrom.returns: String containing the received line, if successful; otherwise, NULL_STRING
CSocket.GetLineFrom.remarks: This method waits for data packages and extracts the first line from input data. Besides this, GetLineFrom() extracts the IP address and port number associated with the received Data. This method can be used by UDP sockets to retrieve datagram packages sent via the Internet.
CSocket.GetLineFrom.example:
The following example implements a simple socket server function listening for the first datagram package at port 7:
FUNCTION ServerTest2() AS VOID PASCAL LOCAL oSocket AS CSocket LOCAL cData AS STRING LOCAL cFrom AS STRING LOCAL nPort AS INT oSocket := CSocket{SOCK_DGRAM} IF oSocket:bind(7, NULL_STRING, AF_INET) oSocket:TimeOut := 10000 cData := oSocket:GetLineFrom(@cFrom, @nPort) IF cFrom == NULL_STRING ? "Timeout expired, no data received :-(" ELSE ? "Data received from ", cFrom, ; , "Client port: ", NTrim(nPort) ? "Received data:" , cData ENDIF ENDIF oSocket:Close() RETURN

CSocket.getpeername.summary: Get the address of the peer to which the socket is connected.
CSocket.getpeername.param: Reference to a string to receive the peer's IP address.
Reference to a DWORD value to receive the peer's port number.
CSocket.getpeername.remarks: This method gets the address and port number of the peer to which the socket is connected.

CSocket.GetRaw.summary: Receive all available data from a socket.
CSocket.GetRaw.returns: String containing the received data, if successful; otherwise, NULL_STRING.
CSocket.GetRaw.remarks: This method stores input data to a string. GetRaw() can be used for TCP sockets only, because it assumes that a connection is already established.
CSocket.GetRaw.example:
The following example implements a simple socket server function waiting for connection at port 7 and receiving all data from the client:
FUNCTION ServerTest3() AS VOID PASCAL LOCAL oSocket AS CSocket LOCAL oSockMsg AS CSocket LOCAL cData AS STRING LOCAL cFrom AS STRING LOCAL nPort AS INT oSocket := CSocket{SOCK_STREAM} IF oSocket:bind(7, NULL_STRING, AF_INET) oSocket:listen(1) oSockMsg := oSocket:accept() IF oSockMsg != NULL_OBJECT cData := oSockMsg:GetRaw() oSockMsg:GetPeerName(@cFrom, @nPort) ? "Data received from ", cFrom, ; ", Client port: ", NTrim(nPort) ? "Received data: ", cData ENDIF oSockMsg:Close() ENDIF oSocket:Close() RETURN

CSocket.GetRawText.summary: Receive all available data from a socket.
CSocket.GetRawText.returns: String containing the received data, if successful; otherwise, NULL_STRING.
CSocket.GetRawText.remarks: This method stores input data to a string. GetRaw() can be used for TCP sockets only, because it assumes that a connection is already established.
CSocket.GetRawText.example:
The following example implements a simple socket server function waiting for connection at port 7 and receiving all data from the client:
FUNCTION ServerTest3() AS VOID PASCAL LOCAL oSocket AS CSocket LOCAL oSockMsg AS CSocket LOCAL cData AS STRING LOCAL cFrom AS STRING LOCAL nPort AS INT oSocket := CSocket{SOCK_STREAM} IF oSocket:bind(7, NULL_STRING, AF_INET) oSocket:listen(1) oSockMsg := oSocket:accept() IF oSockMsg != NULL_OBJECT cData := oSockMsg:GetRaw() oSockMsg:GetPeerName(@cFrom, @nPort) ? "Data received from ", cFrom, ; ", Client port: ", NTrim(nPort) ? "Received data: ", cData ENDIF oSockMsg:Close() ENDIF oSocket:Close() RETURN

CSocket.getsockname.summary: Get the local name for a socket.
CSocket.getsockname.param: Reference to a string which is to receive the peer's IP address.
Reference to a DWORD value to receive the peer's port number
CSocket.getsockname.remarks: This method gets the local address and port number of the socket.
CSocket.getsockname.example:
The following example demonstrates the use of this method:
FUNCTION SimpleTest() AS VOID PASCAL LOCAL oSocket AS CSocket LOCAL cIP AS STRING LOCAL nPort AS INT oSocket := CSocket{SOCK_STREAM} IF oSocket:bind(7, NULL_STRING, AF_INET) oSocket:GetSockName(@cIP, @nPort) ? "Local IP ", cIP, ", port: ", NTrim(nPort) ENDIF oSocket:Close() RETURN

CSocket.listen.summary: Establish a socket to listen for an incoming connection.
CSocket.listen.param: The maximum length to which the queue of pending connections can grow.
CSocket.listen.remarks: This method establishes a socket to listen for an incoming connection.

CSocket.SendLine.summary: Send data terminated by CRLF to the connected socket.
CSocket.SendLine.param: Data to be sent via the socket.
CSocket.SendLine.returns: Number of data sent, if successful; otherwise, 0 (zero).
CSocket.SendLine.remarks: Method SendLine() sends a line to the connected socket. This method can be used for TCP sockets only, because it assumes that a connection is already established.
CSocket.SendLine.example:
The following example demonstrates this method:
FUNCTION ClientTest() AS LOGIC PASCAL LOCAL oSocket AS CSocket LOCAL cTo AS STRING LOCAL nPort AS INT oSocket := CSocket{SOCK_STREAM} IF oSocket:connect( HostName(), 7) IF oSocket:SendLine("Hello world") > 0 oSocket:GetPeerName(@cTo, @nPort) ? "Data sent to ", cTo, ", port: ", NTrim(nPort) ENDIF oSocket:Close() ENDIF RETURN

CSocket.SendLineTo.summary: Send data terminated by CRLF to a specific destination.
CSocket.SendLineTo.param: Data to be sent via the socket.
String containing the host name of an Internet server. Alternately, the string can contain the IP number of the site in ASCII dotted-decimal format (for example, 11.22.3.45).
CSocket.SendLineTo.returns: Number of data sent, if successful; otherwise, 0 (zero).
CSocket.SendLineTo.remarks: This method sends a line to a destination without establishing a connection. SendLine() can be used for UDP sockets to send datagram packages via the Internet.
CSocket.SendLineTo.example:
The following example demonstrates the use of this method:
FUNCTION ClientTest1() AS LOGIC PASCAL LOCAL oSocket AS CSocket LOCAL cTo AS STRING LOCAL nPort AS INT oSocket := CSocket{SOCK_DGRAM} IF oSocket:SendLineTo("Hello world", HostName(), 7) ? "Datagram package sent ... " ENDIF oSocket:Close() RETURN

CSocket.SendRaw.summary: Send any data to the connected socket.
CSocket.SendRaw.param: Pointer to the data to be sent via the socket.
Length of the data to be sent.
CSocket.SendRaw.remarks: SendRaw() sends raw data to the connected socket. This method can be used for TCP sockets only, because it assumes that a connection is already established.
CSocket.SendRaw.example:
The following example demonstrates the use of this method:
FUNCTION ClientTest2() AS LOGIC PASCAL LOCAL oSocket AS CSocket LOCAL cTo AS STRING LOCAL cData AS STRING LOCAL nSize AS INT LOCAL nPort AS INT CLS oSocket := CSocket{SOCK_STREAM} IF oSocket:connect( HostName(), 7) cData := MemoRead("Test.txt") nSize := SLen(cData) IF oSocket:SendRaw(PTR(_CAST, cData), nSize) oSocket:GetPeerName(@cTo, @nPort) ? "Data sent to ", cTo, ", port: ", ; NTrim(nPort) ENDIF ENDIF oSocket:Close() RETURN

CSocket.SendRawText.summary: Send any data to the connected socket.
CSocket.SendRawText.param: Pointer to the data to be sent via the socket.
Length of the data to be sent.
CSocket.SendRawText.remarks: SendRaw() sends raw data to the connected socket. This method can be used for TCP sockets only, because it assumes that a connection is already established.
CSocket.SendRawText.example:
The following example demonstrates the use of this method:
FUNCTION ClientTest2() AS LOGIC PASCAL LOCAL oSocket AS CSocket LOCAL cTo AS STRING LOCAL cData AS STRING LOCAL nSize AS INT LOCAL nPort AS INT CLS oSocket := CSocket{SOCK_STREAM} IF oSocket:connect( HostName(), 7) cData := MemoRead("Test.txt") nSize := SLen(cData) IF oSocket:SendRaw(PTR(_CAST, cData), nSize) oSocket:GetPeerName(@cTo, @nPort) ? "Data sent to ", cTo, ", port: ", ; NTrim(nPort) ENDIF ENDIF oSocket:Close() RETURN

CSocket.Status.summary: Numeric value with the current status representing one of the following states:
CSocket.Status.value: Numeric value with the current status representing one of the following states:

CSocket.TimeOut.summary: Numeric value representing the time-out in milliseconds.
CSocket.TimeOut.value: Numeric value representing the time-out in milliseconds.

CStorage.summary: Provide an interface to handle large Email Messages and attachments
CStorage.remarks:
This class is used Exclusively by the CEMail Class to read and write attachments. The class reads/writes attachments in a disk folder. If you want to store attachments on another location (for example a SQL Database) then you should subclass this class and override the implementation of the methods. CStorage also gives you an interface to store the raw data of received emails. During reception of an email the following three methods are called: RawNew() RawWrite() RawClose() You can use these methods to implement your own mechanism to save the raw email contents.
This class provides an interface that is used to handle streaming of inbound and outbound messages

CStorage.AttachmentAdd.summary: This method is called when an email is received to initialize the saving of a new attachment. The implementation in CStorage generates a unique ID and creates the (empty) file.
CStorage.AttachmentAdd.param: Contains the file name of the attachment.

The Coding type. Can be one of the following values:
CODING_TYPE_7BIT CODING_TYPE_8BIT CODING_TYPE_BASE64 CODING_TYPE_NONE CODING_TYPE_PRINTABLE CODING_TYPE_UNKNOWN CODING_TYPE_UUENCODE
In most cases it is CODING_TYPE_BASE64 and only this type is implemented in the CStorage class.
CStorage.AttachmentAdd.returns: STRING The unique ID. If AttachmentAdd() fails it returns a NULL_STRING.

CStorage.AttachmentClose.summary: This method is called after receiving of an attachment or after reading of an attachment from the storage during sending. The implementation in CStorage closes an open file.

CStorage.AttachmentDelete.summary: This method returns the full path of an attachment file addressed through cAttachID.
CStorage.AttachmentDelete.param: Contains the ID or the full path of the attachment.
CStorage.AttachmentDelete.returns: LOGIC TRUE when the attachment could be deleted.

CStorage.AttachmentFullPath.summary: This method returns the full path of an attachment file addressed through cAttachID.
CStorage.AttachmentFullPath.param: Contains the ID or the full path of the attachment.If it is a full path the first character of cAttachID is ATTACHID_PATHFLAG (>)
CStorage.AttachmentFullPath.returns: STRING The full path of an attachment file

CStorage.AttachmentOpen.summary: This method is called during sending of an email, if an attachment have to be sent. It prepares the loading process from the storage. In our case it addresses the attachment file and opens it.
CStorage.AttachmentOpen.param: Contains the ID or the full path of the attachment.

Contains the coding type. It can be one of the following values:
CODING_TYPE_7BIT
CODING_TYPE_8BIT
CODING_TYPE_BASE64
CODING_TYPE_NONE
CODING_TYPE_PRINTABLE
CODING_TYPE_UNKNOWN
CODING_TYPE_UUENCODE
In most cases it is CODING_TYPE_BASE64 and only this type is implemented in the CStorage class.
CStorage.AttachmentOpen.returns: LOGIC TRUE when the attachment could be opened successfully.

CStorage.AttachmentRead.summary: This method is called during sending of an attachment. It reads a data block from the attachment file. In our implementation it reads 1536 bytes. The result string is the encoded value of this data block.
CStorage.AttachmentRead.returns: STRING The encoded value of this data block.

CStorage.AttachmentSave.summary: Stores the attachment with the ID cAttachID to the file cToFile. cToFile must be a full path name. This method is called from CEMail:SaveAs().
CStorage.AttachmentSave.param: Contains the ID or the full path of the attachment.
Contains the full path name of the target file.
CStorage.AttachmentSave.returns: STRING The unique ID. If AttachmentAdd() fails it returns a NULL_STRING.

CStorage.AttachmentSize.summary: Returns the file size of a currently stored or an opened attachment file. This access is called during receiving an email.
CStorage.AttachmentSize.value: The file size of a currently stored or an opened attachment file. This access is called during receiving an email.

CStorage.AttachmentWrite.summary: This method is called multiple times per attachment during the receive process.
CStorage.AttachmentWrite.param: Contains the encoded attachment data. For BASE64 encoded data the length of cData is mostly 78 characters.The default implementation decodes cData and writes it into the file.

CStorage.CreateNewMail.summary: This method returns a new empty CEMail object.

CStorage.LoadEMail.summary: This method returns a CEMail object filled with all data addressed through the cID. You have to implement this method and the meaning of cID. THIS METHOD IS NOT IMPLEMENTED IN CSTORAGE AND NOT CALLED BY THE INTERNET CLASSES
CStorage.LoadEMail.param: Contains a unique identifier that describes the Email

CStorage.NoSave.summary: You can use this assign to suppress the storing of the attachments into the storage. This makes sense, if you want to store only raw email files.
CStorage.NoSave.value: You can use this assign to suppress the storing of the attachments into the storage. This makes sense, if you want to store only raw email files.
CStorage.NoSave.param: TRUE suppresses saving of attachments. In that case you need to implement the Raw..() methods in your CStorage subclass to save the raw emails.

CStorage.RawClose.summary: This method is called when an email was received completely.
CStorage.RawClose.param: Contains the file name of the attachment.

remarks.note: It is not recommended to decode raw emails in memory as one single string. The preferred mechanism is to stream them to disk or to a database. "streaming" instead. Look into the method EmailWindowMain:ImportMail() of the email sample to see how easy this works. If you want to see how to send an email into a raw email file look into the method EmailStore:SendMailAsFile() of the email sample.

CStorage.RawNew.summary: This method is called at the beginning before any data is received. You have to implement how you want to store and address the raw data here.
CStorage.RawNew.param: Email object for the mail that is received. Note that almost all of the properties of this object will be empty.

remarks.note: It is not recommended to decode raw emails in memory as one single string. The preferred mechanism is to stream them to disk or to a database. "streaming" instead. Look into the method EmailWindowMain:ImportMail() of the email sample to see how easy this works. If you want to see how to send an email into a raw email file look into the method EmailStore:SendMailAsFile() of the email sample.

CStorage.RawWrite.summary: Now this method is called multiple times until the complete email including all attachments is received. You have to implement how you want to store each data block.
CStorage.RawWrite.param: Contains the file name of the attachment.
CStorage.RawWrite.returns: STRING The unique ID. If AttachmentAdd() fails it returns a NULL_STRING.

remarks.note: It is not recommended to decode raw emails in memory as one single string. The preferred mechanism is to stream them to disk or to a database. "streaming" instead. Look into the method EmailWindowMain:ImportMail() of the email sample to see how easy this works. If you want to see how to send an email into a raw email file look into the method EmailStore:SendMailAsFile() of the email sample.

CStorage.SaveAttachments.summary: This method stores all attachments of an email into the storage.
CStorage.SaveAttachments.param: The Email from which the attachments need to be saved to the storage.
If lClone is TRUE and oEMail was loaded from the storage new copies of the attachments are stored into the storage.
CStorage.SaveAttachments.returns: STRING The unique ID. If AttachmentAdd() fails it returns a NULL_STRING.

CStorage.SaveEMail.summary: This method stores a CEMail object including all data under the address of the cID. You have to implement this method and the meaning of cID. THIS METHOD IS NOT IMPLEMENTED IN CSTORAGE AND NOT CALLED BY THE INTERNET CLASSES
CStorage.SaveEMail.returns: LOGIC TRUE when the email was saved succesfully
